{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3328825,"name":"Nathaniel Skiera","username":"Naskiera","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/71e660/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-10T02:48:58.192Z","cooked":"

I have no idea what I’m doing. We have no actual coder. I am the build captain and have had to learn everything. Swerve works now. I have mk4is with neos. And we can shoot in Auton. But no move. So we wanted to use pathfinder but I have no idea what it is. Is there an example code that uses mk4is and neos that I can use and modify

i am in the exact point that you are. A team that helped me with swerve programation said to me that sometimes depending of who is programming, you can find it more easy to use a sequential command group with trajectories controlled by a swervecontrollercommand with commands of shooter/arm in the middle. i am working on this too, so if you find something, please share with us

I’ve been working on this recently for my team. We use MK4is, NEOs, Pigeon2, Limelight, and CANcoders.

Here is our repo if you want to check it out -GitHub - panthertech292/2024_r: Main robot code 2024

Though please note, I am using YAGSL as our swerve library, so things might look different if you are not.

I register named commands in the robot container. I can then make paths in the PathPlanner app. Still in the PathPlanner app, I make an auto using said paths and named commands. Then I select the auto I created in PathPlanner in the robot container.

This is my first year doing this (PathPlanner & Swerve), so what you see might not be the best practice or implementation, but it works at the very least for us.

A great resource is the ctre6 swerve example github repository and one of the examples is swerve with path planner. This is basically the code i used to start my drivetrain and it has been pretty helpful. Along with that, if you need some frc programming knowledge, I would super seriously recommend the 0 to autonomous youtube series which teaches you literally all you need to know about FRC programming.

Let me know if you want any more help
